meanings.definition: A sound made by a clock or similar device, typically indicating the passing of time.
meanings.sent1: The tictoc of the clock helped me fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tictoc of the grandfather clock in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The tictoc of the clock seemed to be whispering secrets to me.
meanings.sent4: As the tictoc of the clock echoed through the room, time felt like a gentle river flowing by.
meanings.sent5: The constant tictoc of the clock became a comforting lullaby.

meanings.definition: To make a ticking or clicking sound.
meanings.sent1: I could tictoc the pen against the table while thinking.
meanings.sent2: The old typewriter would tictoc loudly in the quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The rain on the window would tictoc like a soft melody.
meanings.sent4: Her heels tictoced on the wooden floor, announcing her arrival.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the metronome tictocing helped her keep pace while playing the piano.

meanings.definition: A social media platform for short-form videos.
meanings.sent1: I spend hours watching funny videos on Tictoc.
meanings.sent2: She became famous overnight after posting a video on Tictoc.
meanings.sent3: My cat has more followers on Tictoc than I do!
meanings.sent4: Tictoc has revolutionized how we consume entertainment in short bursts.
meanings.sent5: The dance challenges on Tictoc are so addictive!
